channel.title: Changeset comments are editable in TFS
channel.description: A feature of changeset metadata in Team Foundation Server 2008 is that it is actually editable. If you look at the changeset details for a historical check-in in Visual Studio you will notice that the comment and check-in notes fields...
channel.dc:creator: Martin

item.title: Comment by Tara+00:00
item.description: That was helpful, glad you made a post of it for others to benefit too. :)
item.dc:creator: Tara

item.title: Comment by Eyal+00:00
item.description: found my self quite a few times editing comments even just for spelling fixes or when educating new developers about the fact that comments should contains more info than just "bug fix"
item.dc:creator: Eyal

item.title: Comment by Matt R+00:00
item.description: I agree. I have also run into a few instances where I've had need to update the comments. In some cases, they were just typos. In other cases, I had forgotten to list a specific change I had committed, and wanted to record it in the comments. The need doesn't come up very often, but it is a feature I've found useful.
item.dc:creator: Matt R
